title: Allow multiple versions of the same package in the DAG in some situations.
body:
Part of my goal here: #2320 is to make `py-jupyter_notebook` work for both python 2 and python 3. The problem is that `node-js` (a dependency of `py-jupyter_notebook`) requires python 2 and not python 3 for their build system to work. When I change the `node-js` speciifcation to reflect this, I get the error

```
spack install py-jupyter_notebook ^python@3.5.2~ucs4
==> Error: Invalid spec: 'python@3.5.2~ucs4^bzip2^ncurses^openssl^readline^sqlite^zlib'. Package python requires version 2.7:2.7.999, but spec asked for 3.5.2
```

Likely because concretization has selected 3.5.2 as 'the' python package to use so it won't use a separate python for a build dependency of one of the packages.

I believe that spack's DAG needs to be more flexible to allow situations like this.

This is related to the discussion here: #2448 about how build dependencies are 'promoted' to run dependencies if that package is listed as a run dependency for a superior package. This is another example why this is bad behavior.
